section.section: This subsection does not limit the right of an individual to provide for distribution of property by will.

Except as provided in § 2-123 of the Real Property Article, after a court enters an order for adoption under this subtitle:
the adoptee:
is the child of the adoptive parent for all intents and purposes; and
is entitled to all of the rights and privileges of and is subject to all of the obligations of offspring born to the adoptive parent;
each of the adoptee's living parents is:
relieved of all parental duties and obligations to the adoptee; and
divested of all parental rights as to the adoptee; and
the Estates and Trusts Article shall govern all of the rights of inheritance between the adoptee and parental relatives.

text.section: An order for adoption under this subtitle terminates all pending guardianship cases as to the adoptee.
Adoption of an adult has the same legal effect as adoption of a minor.

section.section:
When a court enters an order for a child's adoption under this subtitle, the court shall send notice to:
each court that has a pending guardianship case as to the adoptee;
each of the child's living, former parents who has not waived the right to notice; and
the former guardian of the child.
Service on a parent under this subsection shall be at the parent's last address known to the court.
